Description: White limestone false-door of Qar: at the top there is a plain cavetto-cornice and the inscribed area is surrounded by a plain forus-moulding. There are three vertical panels on each side of the doorway. The lintel bears a simple ḥtp-dỉ-nsw formula, and the six vertical panels carry Qar's titles and dignities; his titles also occur on the small, subsidiary lintel. These texts are carved in sunk relief of moderate quality. At the bottom of each vertical panel there is a standing figure of Qar who is shown in various attitudes of authority; these figures are carved in sunk relief of a peculiarly gauche nature. The rectangular panel above the doorway has a representation of Qar seated behind an offering-table, carved in fair, low relief. Above the table is incised a short ḥtp-dỉ-nsw text. The surface in general is sound apart from that of the rectangular panel carved in low relief; some flaking can be detected here. No colour remains.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 67; Part 1, 302.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.32)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
